questiontext.text:
Key Point

The three PDEs of greatest general interest involving two independent variables are:

  1. The two-dimensional Laplace equation \[\dfrac{\partial^2u}{\partial x^2}+\dfrac{\partial^2u}{\partial y^2}=0\]
  2. The one-dimensional heat conduction equation: \[\dfrac{\partial^2u}{\partial x^2}=\dfrac{1}{k}\dfrac{\partial u}{\partial t}\]
  3. The one-dimensional wave equation: \[\dfrac{\partial^2u}{\partial x^2}=\dfrac{1}{c^2}\dfrac{\partial^2u}{\partial t^2}\]
